headline: Exclusive-Kazakhstan's Tengiz oilfield seen recovering less than half its output by February 7, sources say
summary: MOSCOW, Jan 27 () - Kazakhstan's biggest oilfield, Tengiz, is likely to have restored less than half of its normal production by February 7 as it slowly recovers from a fire and power outage, two sources ​familiar with the matter told . The shutdown of Tengiz, one of the world's biggest oilfields, has been another ‌setback for Kazakhstan, whose main export route was limited over recent months after an attack by Ukrainian naval drones.

headline: Oil Holds Loss on Supply Outlook as Traders Monitor US Freeze
summary: West Texas Intermediate traded below $61 a barrel after closing 0.7% lower on Monday, while Brent was near $65.  Kazakhstan’s largest producer is preparing to resume output at the giant Tengiz field, while Chevron Corp. works to bring more Venezuelan crude to an already well-supplied market.  “Winter storms normally tend to affect oil through short-term logistics and refining disruptions rather than underlying demand,” said Haris Khurshid, chief investment officer at Karobaar Capital LP.
